content.text:
# International Journal of Historical Archaeology

The International Journal of Historical Archaeology is an academic journal devoted to the archaeology of historical sites.
Historical archaeology in the Americas focuses on the post-1492 period and extends into the Late Medieval period. It is understood to highlight global connections between sites, regions, and continents, and contributes to theoretical, methodological, and site-specific research. It serves as a resource for archaeologists, students, historians, and preservationists, and includes input from an international community of experts.
